column4: Hey. I've got a problem. Everytime my PC returns from Suspend, my internet connection isn't working. I've tried disconnecting/reconnecting, and to disable/enable networking. The only thing that seems to work is to physically plug in/out my internet cable
what version of ubuntu do you have
hmmm i know that 10.04 had a lot of issues with that
I guess they haven't been solved in 11.04 yet :O Or I'm just doing something incredibly wrong
jus ta moment let me look around, is it a desktop or laptop?
It's a desktop. It's a physical connection, not wi-fi
found a thread that is new that talks about your problem, sounds like they made a change to the way acpi handles networking on suspend: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1777685
I had weird issues during installation as well. At the timezone window, the installation would freeze unless I would install it without internet connection.
Does the thread solve the issue as well?
is your nic a broadcom? they haven't posted back but it sounds like a valid resolution
My network card is built into the motherboard. Allow me a minute to find out more details about it
if i had to guess i would say it's a broadcom
I never heard of broadcom before regarding my PC, so I doubt it
give that link a try, it's modern and it seems there is an off and on option, try both to see what happens
Would you mind directing me to the actual link? Thanks :p
A found it, I missed it. Sorry!
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1777685
all good
The thread seems to deal with wireless connections that become invisible. I am using a physical cable connection, and it's visible after suspend, but it just won't connect

the same principle applies. wireless will acti differently with the same problem vs wired. The thread is about acpi suspending the networking and freezing or not becoming available. therefore it should still apply
I'll have another look at it. Thank you for reminding me of the word 'wired' by the way. And thank you for your support! :)
